N A E B CONVENTION 1961
Report of the Resolutions Co'nmittee
Meetingr at its 37th Annual Convention in TCashinjSjton, D^Coj
Oct:ober 22-26, 1961, the National Association of Educational
Broadcasters:
lo Wholeheartedly commends the Federal Communications
Commission for its interest in, and concern with,
educational broadcasting, and for the establishment
of a Research and Education Division devoted to the
purpose of more effective utilization of the channels
of communication for education and the national interest.
2o Strongly urges the favorable consideration of legis¬
lation providing Federal aid to assist in the needed
development of educational televisioHo
So Strongly urges the enactment of enabling legislation
in connection with the Florence Agreement concerning
the duty-free import of selected educational materials
and resources in the interest of the needed development
of international educational exchangee
4o Strongly urges that no changes be made in postal
regulations affecting the costs or rates of mailing
of educational and library materials which would lead
to any decrease or reduction in the availability and
use of such necessary resources.
So Strongly urges the Federal Communications Commission
to authorize the new Division of Research and Education
to work closely wdth the NAEB and all educational
interests in the long-range planning of frequency
allocations and spectrum assignments to insure the
adequate provision of communication channels for the
purpose of meeting all requirements for a truly
national educational broadcasting servicco
6q Strongly urges the favorable consideration of legis¬
lation leading to the expanded manufacture and dis¬
tribution of all-channel television receivers in the
interest of the development of UHF-TV which is necessary
to provide a truly national television serviceo
Respectfully Submitted;
NAEB Resolutions Committee
James Fellows
Larry Frymire
Armand Hunter, Chairman
